channel.title: My Pokémon archive editor program
channel.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Wr9sKqMUpQ
Looking for feedback on the design of the tool. It's my first time working with Swing.

item.title: My Pokémon archive editor program
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

To add on to what has been said: instead of having to press the save button for the sprite to be updated, listen for either focus lost or key up on the text field and try to load a sprite that matches the input. You’ll eventually want a graphical chooser for the sprites as well. You don’t want to memorize each one or use trial and error to find it.

Read full topic

item.title: My Pokémon archive editor program
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:2, topic:551833”]simple answer: start over that ui is shit
informative answer (bleh): align the text boxes, change the look and feel, align the buttons, no random gap on the right, no lack of gap at the bottom, no title bar?[/quote]

Thanks, I’ll try to figure out how to do those. This won’t be for public use, just a backend tool for a project of mine

Read full topic
